entry.title: Preparativos para o SAP Inside Track Porto 2025- Reuni√£o de alinhamento.
entry.content:
üöÄPreparativos a todo vapor para o SAP Inside Track Porto!

Ontem tivemos nossa reuni√£o de alinhamento com a incr√≠vel equipe de volunt√°rios que vai ajudar a fazer o evento acontecer. üí™‚ú®

Distribu√≠mos as principais frentes de apoio, garantindo que cada detalhe seja cuidado com carinho:

  • Cadastramento: 4 pessoas para recepcionar e registrar os participantes

  • Controle de tempo das palestras: 1 pessoa para manter tudo no cronograma

  • Apoio aos palestrantes: 1 pessoa dedicada a avisar quem est√° ‚Äúna fila‚Äù para subir ao palco

  • Suporte de som e imagem: 2 pessoas para garantir que todo mundo veja e ou√ßa bem

  • Entrevistas: 4 pessoas para registrar depoimentos e momentos especiais

üôåObrigado a todos que se voluntariaram! Voc√™s s√£o a alma do evento e fazem toda a diferen√ßa para que cada participante viva uma experi√™ncia memor√°vel.

üìÖFalta pouco para o #SITPorto ‚Äî e estamos prontos para receber a comunidade SAP com muita energia e organiza√ß√£o!

#SAPInsideTrack #SITPorto #ComunidadeSAP #Voluntariado #SAPCommunity

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: Popular Posts, Blog It Forward, Site Updates, and More
entry.content:
We were really happy to see the positive response to the relaunch of our online SAP Community Voice newsletter. Based on this reaction, we‚Äôre aiming to deliver two newsletters per month, following the same cadence as the retired email version. That means every few weeks (likely on the 15th and final day of every month), we‚Äôll publish a post in What‚Äôs New to highlight popular member-contributed content, a summary of important community news, a look at upcoming events, and more.

Enjoy this latest edition, and we‚Äôll be back before the end of August with another newsletter!

 

Featured Content

 

SAP Datasphere Replication Flow Logs: Monitoring and Insights

We love content that draws engagement, and this contribution from @vikasparmar88 does just that! He writes about how to track replication-flow execution by accessing key metadata tables and diagnostic views within SAP Datasphere, and members are expressing their gratitude (and following up) in the comments.

Read the blog post

 

SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA: Pro Tips for SAP Fiori Demos

Long-time community contributor (and SAP employee) @Jocelyn_Dart is sharing tips and tricks for demonstrating SAP Fiori as a functional consultant. This post covers navigation. If you find it useful, make sure to check out SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Pro-tips for demonstrating SAP Fiori ‚Äì Organizing your My Home page as well. More to come!

Read the blog post

 

SAP Business Data Cloud: Introduction and Deep Dive!

As the title suggests, this post from @NarasinghaPrasadPatro includes his thoughts about SAP Business Data Cloud. He covers what this solution delivers, its key features, how it differs from similar offerings, how partners are developing applications for it, and much more.

Read the blog post

 

Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build

SAP‚Äôs @Diganta_Mandal kicked off a multi-part series designed to walk readers through the end-to-end setup and usage of Joule Studio. In part one, he focuses on provisioning -- laying the foundation for a successful Joule skill-development journey. (If you enjoy this post, make sure to check out the other parts of this series!)

Read the blog post

 

Community News

 

‚ÄúBlog It Forward‚Äù Keeps Moving Forward!

The latest entry in our popular Blog It Forward series comes courtesy of SAP Mentor @Marla-Schwaiki. Get to know Marla by reading her post, and consider participating in this series yourself. You don‚Äôt need to wait for someone to nominate you! Check out this post for tips on structuring a ‚ÄúBlog It Forward‚Äù  contribution, then submit one of your own in the Community Corner blog board with the ‚ÄúBlog It Forward‚Äù label and user tag so other members can find your post. Also, subscribe to the Blog It Forward label so you get notifications whenever someone publishes a new entry. ‚ÄúBlog It Forward‚Äù is a great way for members to get to know you ‚Äì and for you to connect with other members!

 

New Topic Pages

In the last few weeks, we have launched three new topic pages: SAP S/4HANA Selective Data Transition Engagement, Settlement Management, and SAP Engineering Control Center. If these subjects interest you, you‚Äôll want to visit these pages for relevant content, as well as links to learning resources, useful tools, information about upcoming events, and more.

 

The Latest Fixes and Features

If you missed the What‚Äôs New post from Monday the 11th, here‚Äôs a reminder of the platform improvements introduced earlier this week. We added a new sort feature to the activity feeds for our Knowledge Base boards, fixed an issue with the general notifications feed, and (best of all) added share buttons to various content pages, making it easier for members to send links to SAP Community blog posts, discussions, and other contributions! See New Features and Fixes: Share Buttons, Notifications Feed, and More to get additional details about these updates.

 

Upcoming Events

 

Reasons to Attend SAP TechEd

SAP TechEd is returning in November with a hybrid experience. The in-person event in Berlin promises an amazing, educational time for attendees, but if you‚Äôre like SAP Champion @DanielMateo, you may be unable to make the trip. The good news is that you can still join the event virtually! Read Daniel‚Äôs Why I'm Attending SAP TechEd 2025 Virtually and Top Picks post to see why online participation might be a great option for you. SAP Community will have a big presence at SAP TechEd, so we look forward to seeing you ‚Äì whether in Berlin or online!

 

Find SAP CodeJam Events in Your Region

SAP CodeJam events bring together developers who want hands-on learning for SAP technology, solutions, and applications. Next month, you can attend SAP CodeJam sessions in 's-Hertogenbosch (the Netherlands), Cologne (Germany), Mechelen (Belgium), Warsaw (Poland), Hamburg (Germany), and Porto (Portugal). Visit the SAP CodeJam activity group to learn more about these events, and check out the full list of upcoming events. Also, look for location groups near you, as these groups often host events as well.

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!
entry.content:
We are thrilled to announce that Devtoberfest, an SAP TechEd event, returns this year running from September 29th - October 24th, 2025. It's a celebration for SAP developers and an excellent way to get ready for SAP TechEd. If you weren't around for Devtoberfest in 2020 -2024; here's a quick video overview of the event:

The Devtoberfest tracks have changed but no worries the new tracks are listed down below!

 
I‚Äôll repeat the same overall description we‚Äôve used the past few years as it does an excellent job of capturing the spirit of the event:

Devtoberfest is an attempt to capture the experience of the pre-conference events, like SAP InnoJam of years‚Äô past. It‚Äôs an event which kicks off the SAP TechEd season. Devtoberfest takes some of the best aspects of the traditional hackathon type event, such as learning by building something, but opens the experience to the entire community and spreads across multiple weeks to better accommodate everyone‚Äôs busy schedules. It‚Äôs an event that is also designed for you to be able to participate asynchronously and on your own time schedule. As the idea formed, we‚Äôve seen an opportunity here to really build something that is truly a festival for developers.

Devtoberfest ‚Äì An open celebration of what makes us developers ‚Äì Coding and Collaboration!
 
Getting Started with Devtoberfest
 
You are in the right place.  The home for the event will again be this SAP Community Group - where you find yourself right now. There is this dedicated SAP Community Group for Devtoberfest and all the individual events will be listed in the SAP Community Events calendar.  

This means no registration on a third-party event site or having to manually link to your SAP Community account. You register for Devtoberfest by reviewing the legal terms and conditions posted in this group and then just joining the Devtoberfest group. If you already joined in 2022, 2023 or 2024, then you are ready to participate again this year. 
 
Continuing with a similar overall approach as the last two years, this Devtoberfest will be ripe with educational and enablement sessions, opportunities to get hands-on with new and evolving developer tools, and a wonderful way to get you ready for the upcoming SAP TechEd event.
 
And if you prefer a video tutorial on signing up for Devtoberfest:

Educational Content
The backbone of Devtoberfest remains the educational content sessions. Devtoberfest is still an event designed for asynchronous consumption. While we will release content every weekday during Devtoberfest, it's all intended that you consume the content on your own schedule.
 
This year's tracks are the following:

üü¢ Monday ‚Äì ABAP

üü£ Tuesday ‚Äì Tooling & Frontend

üî¥Wednesday ‚Äì Integration

üîµThursday ‚Äì Data & AI

üü† Friday ‚Äì CAP

üü° All Week ‚Äì Fun Activities

 
Fun Activities
This is a celebration so the Fun Friday activities will return, somewhat. This year we are changing things up a bit. Instead of having a Fun Friday, we have lots of fun activities sprinkled in throughout the week! There will be pro-active fun activities but also community fun activities like Petoberfest happening over the span of Devtoberfest.
We saw the greatest amount of participation last year in the activities that didn't require you to show up at a specific time, so we will continue to utilize those kinds of activities this year.
 
For all the information on the Fun Activities: coming soon!
 
The Contest
2022 saw the introduction of the grand prize of the Winner's Retreat to Newport Beach and Disneyland. It was great fun and hugely successful. The 2023 winners were joining us at the SAP TechEd road show (ASUG Tech Connect) in November 2024 which was an amazing experience.

The winners of 2024 are joining us this year (2025) in Berlin for SAP TechEd to learn, and to engage with SAP and the community! Congratulations to our 2024 winners!
 
When something works that well, why change it up; so again this year the grand prize for Devtoberfest will be a similar retreat to a future SAP TechEd event (in 2026). 
 
For all the information on the Content - coming soon!
For the Contest Official Rules - Devtoberfest 2025 Contest Official Rules - SAP Community
And we have a prize FAQ - Devtoberfest 2025 Grand Prize Trip FAQ - SAP Community
 
Questions, Comments, or Feedback
Questions about the event? Or the judging? Or you have a follow up question after participating in one of the educational enablement sessions? For any question or comment related to Devtoberfest we ask that you please use the dedicated Devtoberfest Discussions board available here.
 
Legal Stuff
It wouldn‚Äôt be any kind of event or contest without some legal content that I‚Äôm sure everyone will read in full detail. The legal terms and conditions for the 2025 event are coming soon.

entry.title: Bringing Back Badges to Reward Q&A Experts!
entry.content:
If you‚Äôve been a long-time member of SAP Community, you‚Äôve probably accumulated several badges over the years. Even newer members may have earned the basic one-time badges available on our current platform ‚Äì such as the badge for taking our tutorial and the various badges awarded for a first-time action (e.g., replying, leaving a kudo). Members haven‚Äôt, however, been able to receive ongoing recognition for repeated activity.

That will change starting tomorrow (Tuesday, August 19).

With our previous gamification system, we rewarded badges for posting quality content, providing helpful answers, and more ‚Äì giving members the opportunity to earn multiple awards for frequent participation. (As an example, take a look at my list of badges ‚Äì which pales compared to the accomplishments of veterans who have been around since the earliest days of our online community!) As of August 19, we‚Äôre bringing this recognition back, starting with progression badges based on the number of answers accepted as solutions.

If you like answering questions (and you‚Äôre gifted at helping other members find solutions to their problems), then you‚Äôve probably already received the first badge in this new series ‚Äì by giving an answer that was accepted as a solution. Now you can earn an additional four badges, depending on the number of solutions you provided in Q&A.

We‚Äôll be rewarding people retroactively, so depending on your Q&A activity and length of community membership (going back to previous community platforms), you may get one or more badges tomorrow.

Not sure of your numbers? You can find them in your community content area. After logging in, click on the person icon in the upper right of any community page, then select ‚ÄúMy content.‚Äù

You‚Äôll see your total number of answers in the Private Stats section at the bottom of your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù area.

But remember: an answer is not a solution. An answer becomes a solution when someone accepts it as the correct answer to a question. You‚Äôll find your total number of solutions in the gray box at the top of your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page.

So in this example, this member should expect to get all four of the new solutions badges. With 93 solutions, he has achieved the necessary criteria for the second badge (2 solutions), third badge (5 solutions), fourth badge (25 solutions), and the fifth and final badge in this progression series (50 solutions). (I sure hope he‚Äôs reading this, so he won‚Äôt wonder what‚Äôs going on when he sees four badge notifications tomorrow.)

If you are expecting badges, and you're not seeing them yet, try logging out and in again. That should update the badge list in your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page.

With this new badge set, SAP Community is once again acknowledging the awesome members who regularly contribute quality content. And we‚Äôre not stopping here! In the near future, we plan to introduce other progression sets. We don‚Äôt want to give away too much information just yet ‚Äì we thought it would be fun to keep things a surprise ‚Äì but we do encourage you to get more active, as you may find yourself receiving bigger badge payoffs very soon.

Make sure to monitor the What‚Äôs New section for announcements about the new progression badge sets as they become available. In the meantime, if you frequently participate in the community, keep up the good work. Or if you‚Äôre more of a lurker, consider jumping in and building up the numbers necessary for badges. Depending on what you do (and what you‚Äôve done), you may find yourself the recipient of several shiny new badges as we extend the ways in which we show appreciation for those who make our community a better place!

OK, one hint: We aren‚Äôt just going to reward the members active in Q&A, so if answering questions isn‚Äôt your thing, you can still gain badges for other activities. Experiment with meaningful contributions, show your support for other members, and see what happens!

entry.title: Transforma√ß√£o de Neg√≥cios com SAP Signavio e LeanIX
entry.content:
A transforma√ß√£o empresarial √© uma constante para a organiza√ß√£o moderna. Voc√™ precisa ser capaz de pivotar, adaptar e alavancar, n√£o importa como as necessidades do cliente flutuem. E para fazer isso, voc√™ precisa adaptar seus processos de neg√≥cios e arquitetura de tecnologia para dar suporte a voc√™ em quaisquer esfor√ßos que precise empreender para crescer e prosperar. No entanto, √© muito mais f√°cil falar do que fazer, pois a transforma√ß√£o est√° longe de ser algo simples.

Mesmo que voc√™ adote a complexa tarefa de adaptar sua organiza√ß√£o para dar a ela a melhor chance de competir no mercado, voc√™ n√£o pode simplesmente parar de  ganhar dinheiro. Pois n√£o apenas seus acionistas ficar√£o insatisfeitos, mas voc√™ n√£o ser√° capaz de financiar sua transforma√ß√£o sem os recursos necess√°rios.

Como voc√™ adapta seu neg√≥cio √†s necessidades do mercado sem interromper suas opera√ß√µes em andamento? Preparamos uma sele√ß√£o de ferramentas e orienta√ß√µes que v√£o capacitar a evoluir seu neg√≥cio sem deixar de atender as necessidades do mercado.

Transforma√ß√£o empresarial √© uma nova maneira de pensar sobre um problema antigo. O que antes cham√°vamos de "transforma√ß√£o digital" agora se expandiu para incluir qualquer tipo de mudan√ßa de impacto geral na sua organiza√ß√£o.

N√£o precisamos explicar o qu√£o turbulento o mundo se tornou cada vez mais ou como os neg√≥cios que prosperam s√£o aqueles que se adaptam √†s mudan√ßas conforme elas surgem.

Lembre-se:

 

  • A Nintendo j√° foi uma empresa de cartas de baralho
  • A Amazon costumava vender apenas livros
  • A Netflix ofereceu aluguel de DVD

Quando a era digital come√ßou, todos n√≥s inicialmente pensamos que uma √∫nica transforma√ß√£o digital para se adaptar √† nuvem, ao trabalho remoto e ao e-commerce seria suficiente. Claro, agora percebemos que a tecnologia continuar√° a evoluir e precisamos evoluir com ela, mas a tecnologia n√£o √© o √∫nico ponto nessa equa√ß√£o.

 

Arquitetura Empresarial com SAP LeanIX

De eventos sem precedentes a problemas de cadeia de suprimentos em todo o mundo, a empresa precisa estar constantemente pronta para se adaptar √†s necessidades em mudan√ßa do mercado. Longe de uma transforma√ß√£o digital √∫nica, a necessidade de mudan√ßa organizacional se tornou uma press√£o constante.

A √∫nica maneira de lidar com essa press√£o √© fazer da mudan√ßa um processo de neg√≥cios constante. Ao construir agilidade no pr√≥prio tecido da sua organiza√ß√£o, voc√™ pode pivotar e adaptar seu modelo de neg√≥cios a qualquer coisa que aconte√ßa no futuro.

Transforma√ß√£o e agilidade s√£o o seu neg√≥cio agora e v√£o muito al√©m de apenas atualizar para o digital. √â isso que queremos dizer quando falamos sobre transforma√ß√£o empresarial.

No entanto, o problema com a press√£o constante para transformar seu neg√≥cio √© que seu neg√≥cio n√£o pode parar enquanto voc√™ se transforma. Voc√™ n√£o pode simplesmente pausar todas as suas opera√ß√µes enquanto adapta seu modelo de neg√≥cio √†s necessidades atuais do mercado e as necessidades do mercado nunca param de mudar.

Saltando de um trem em movimento...

A transforma√ß√£o empresarial pode parecer como a a√ß√£o de pular de um vag√£o de trem enquanto ele ainda est√° em movimento, apenas para ele seguir em frente sem voc√™. Suas opera√ß√µes de gera√ß√£o de dinheiro podem n√£o ser reduzidas enquanto voc√™ transforma seu neg√≥cio para uma nova maneira de trabalhar.

Por exemplo, digamos que voc√™ precisa atualizar sua plataforma de gerenciamento de relacionamento com o cliente (CRM) para uma vers√£o baseada em nuvem. Voc√™ deixa todos os seus processos na ferramenta antiga primeiro ou assume o trabalho complexo de migrar tudo para a nova solu√ß√£o?

Isso deixa voc√™ com de tr√™s op√ß√µes desagrad√°veis:

 

  1. Cancele suas opera√ß√µes em andamento e perca receita at√© mudar para seu novo sistema
  2. Conclua todos os seus processos atuais e deixe seu pipeline esvaziar antes de lan√ßar seu novo sistema
  3. Execute dois sistemas simult√¢neos ao mesmo tempo e lide com a complexidade adicional

 

As duas primeiras op√ß√µes prejudicar√£o sua receita, enquanto a terceira aumentar√° seus custos. Seja qual for a sua escolha, o problema √© mais do que apenas operacional e ter√° um impacto em seu resultado.

Para evitar perder lucros, o phase out do seu antigo sistema precisaria ser totalmente tranquilo para sua equipe e seus clientes. Sem mencionar que a integra√ß√£o do seu novo sistema precisaria n√£o apenas ser igualmente tranquila, mas o valor precisaria ser imediatamente claro.

...e pulando de volta para outro

A transforma√ß√£o empresarial requer a sa√≠da perfeita de seus clientes e funcion√°rios de suas antigas formas de trabalho, ao mesmo tempo em que os integra √† sua nova estrutura operacional. Para manter nossa met√°fora, isso vai al√©m de pular de um trem em movimento e se torna mais parecido com saltar de um trem em movimento para outro indo na dire√ß√£o oposta, tente imaginar o qu√£o complexo √© isso!

Somada √† mesma complexidade de transi√ß√£o de suas opera√ß√µes para sua nova maneira de fazer neg√≥cios est√° a necessidade de gerenciamento de mudan√ßas. Voc√™ tem que explicar aos seus usu√°rios, tanto funcion√°rios quanto clientes, como a mudan√ßa os beneficiar√° ou a mudan√ßa √© simplesmente uma inconveni√™ncia, e quando a mudan√ßa se torna constante, essa inconveni√™ncia pode se tornar intoler√°vel.

Ao minimizar o esfor√ßo necess√°rio para que seus usu√°rios fa√ßam a transi√ß√£o para seus novos processos e garantir que voc√™ os tenha vendido sobre o valor da transi√ß√£o, voc√™ pode obter a ades√£o das partes interessadas para a mudan√ßa em todos os n√≠veis. Se voc√™ puder repetir esse processo para cada transforma√ß√£o, poder√° construir uma cultura de transforma√ß√£o cont√≠nua que capacitar√° sua organiza√ß√£o a prosperar.

Para fazer isso, no entanto, voc√™ precisa saber precisamente qual valor seu novo processo ter√° para seus verdadeiros stakeholders. Voc√™ precisa entender as defici√™ncias do seu antigo sistema, os pontos problem√°ticos do usu√°rio e como a nova maneira de fazer as coisas superar√° os problemas.

O sucesso da transforma√ß√£o requer uma compreens√£o abrangente dos seus estados atuais e objetivos e de como seus usu√°rios interagem com eles. Obter essa supervis√£o do seu cen√°rio de TI e vis√£o futura requer monitoramento e an√°lise abrangentes, que voc√™ s√≥ pode obter com o conjunto de ferramentas certo.

Transforma√ß√£o empresarial em movimento

A transforma√ß√£o empresarial n√£o √© um processo √∫nico e pronto, e n√£o √© algo que voc√™ pode parar e fazer no seu tempo. O crescimento e a evolu√ß√£o cont√≠nuos do seu neg√≥cio exigem o gerenciamento de duas m√°quinas complexas cheias de pe√ßas m√≥veis e a sincroniza√ß√£o perfeita delas.

Seus estados, atual e alvo, n√£o permanecem est√°veis enquanto voc√™ muda seu neg√≥cio de um para o outro. Seu estado atual continuar√° a mudar, enquanto seu plano para o futuro tamb√©m precisar√° se adaptar e evoluir, tornando ainda mais dif√≠cil planejar sua transi√ß√£o.

Voc√™ n√£o pode fazer isso de olhos vendados, pois precisa monitorar constantemente cada aspecto do seu processo legado e o desenvolvimento de suas novas opera√ß√µes. Isso √© mais do que a an√°lise manual pode lidar, e voc√™ precisa de automa√ß√µes complexas projetadas e constru√≠das para a transforma√ß√£o dos neg√≥cios a fim de garantir o sucesso.

Ao mapear todos os seus recursos e processos de neg√≥cios por meio de pesquisas automatizadas e pesquisas de usu√°rios, voc√™ pode criar uma imagem completa da sua arquitetura existente e dos aplicativos de software e componentes de TI que os suportam. Usando um ambiente de design sandbox avan√ßado, voc√™ pode ent√£o construir uma vis√£o para seus novos processos de neg√≥cios e cen√°rio de TI, e mapear um caminho para chegar l√°.

Com um conjunto de ferramentas avan√ßado para manter todos esses dados em um s√≥ lugar, voc√™ pode acompanhar conforme seus estados atuais e de destino mudam e mudam. Voc√™ tamb√©m pode adaptar seu plano para mudan√ßa conforme voc√™ continua a avan√ßar.

Sem essas capacidades, sua organiza√ß√£o n√£o ser√° capaz de se adaptar a um mundo em r√°pida evolu√ß√£o e voc√™ corre o risco de ficar para tr√°s de seus concorrentes. √â por isso que reunimos o conjunto de ferramentas perfeito para habilitar suas transforma√ß√µes de neg√≥cios agora e no futuro.

SAP LeanIX e Signavio para transforma√ß√£o empresarial

A transforma√ß√£o empresarial requer supervis√£o detalhada e din√¢mica dos processos, aplicativos de software e comportamento do usu√°rio da sua organiza√ß√£o. Para ajudar voc√™ a obter essa clareza sobre o cen√°rio do seu neg√≥cio, criamos um triunvirato de ferramentas para voc√™ usar para impulsionar a transforma√ß√£o cont√≠nua.

Primeiro, o SAP Signavio mapear√° seus processos de neg√≥cios, destacar√° pontos problem√°ticos e dar√° suporte a voc√™ no design de sua nova arquitetura de processos. Para impulsionar a transforma√ß√£o, o WalkMe guiar√° seu pessoal pelos seus novos processos passo a passo e fornecer√° informa√ß√µes abrangentes sobre o comportamento deles.

Por fim, o SAP LeanIX rastrear√° sua tecnologia com um mapa abrangente e relat√≥rios sobre seus aplicativos de software e componentes de TI. Isso o capacitar√° com a intelig√™ncia necess√°ria para fazer a transi√ß√£o para uma nova tecnologia sem interromper suas opera√ß√µes em andamento.

E se voc√™ quer saber mais como as solu√ß√µes da SAP, LeanIX e Signavio, v√£o te apoiar na transforma√ß√£o de neg√≥cios, entre em contato!!

entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Aug '25
entry.content:
Last Thursday night we met at The Greenwood Hotel in North Sydney for another fun Stammtisch event.  It was our first event at the Greenwood, but that venue is well known to lots of the attendees as it is the biggest pub in North Sydney, and very close to the SAP office. Lots of our crew live on the North side of the harbour so it's a little more convenient for them than the city.

We had some tables reserved which were outside on the courtyard but under cover.   It had been a very rainy day but luckily the last heavy shower passed just before we kicked off at 5pm.  We tried out our new 'SAP Stammtisch' sign, which makes it easier for newbies to find the group.

It was a joy to see so many new faces at the event. There were also a couple of friends who hadn't made it to a Stammtisch for a few years, and they were most welcome too.

Put Thursday 23rd October in your diaries, as that is pencilled in for the next event.  We are hoping that we will have an honoured guest from Europe......we are also hoping that the rain stops by then!

entry.title: –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥ SAP Help —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—é

entry.title: ‚ú® Dubai SAP Community ‚Äì Let‚Äôs Connect! ‚ú®
entry.content:
In our last connect during the Code Jam event, we were all deeply focused on learning and exploring technology together. This time, I was thinking it would be wonderful if we could shift the focus a little‚Äîtowards connecting with each other on a personal level, getting to know one another better, and exploring how we can support each other and our customers even more.

I‚Äôd like to propose a get-together on 26th September (evening) in Dubai. The idea is to keep it simple and informal‚Äîwhether in an office space or a casual spot‚Äîjust a chance to meet, share, and strengthen our community bonds.

It would be great if you could share in the comments:
‚úÖ If you‚Äôd like to join
‚úÖ Any suggestions for the venue in Dubai

Looking forward to your thoughts, and I really hope many of us can make it‚Äîit‚Äôll be great to see familiar faces again and welcome new ones too. üåü

entry.title: SAP INSIDE TRACK Kolkata 2025: A Vibe, A Vision, A Voyage!
entry.content:
üñ•Ô∏è Code ü§ù Community ‚ú® Collaboration

I had the absolute honor of volunteering with the help of @DataTherapist  at one of the most dynamic SAP community events of the year, SIT KOLKATA 2025 ‚Äî and wow, what an experience! üí•

Being part of the engine that powered this event gave me a front-row seat to the magic of collaboration and innovation.

üí¨ Keynote - To Boost the Journey

@josh_bentley , Srini reddy Gottimukkula, Pankaj Lal and Revarand Dr. John Felix Raj keynote gave a boost start of the event.

üé§ Sessions that challenged perspectives

Panel Discussion driven by Monimoy Kundu with Sharmistha Sanyal, Pankaj Lal, Prasun Dutta, Debashis Majumder and Tilak Kumar. Another panel discussion driven by Amitava Nag with Prof. Amlan Chakrabarti, Dr. Indranil Mitra, Dr. Saptarsi Goswami, Mr. Sabyasachi Biswas, Mr. Manoj Mishra and Srini reddy Gottimukkula.

Supply Chain Transformation through AI by Jayabharathy Jothiprakasam, Warehouse Operation by Next-Gen AI Mobile Application by Avik Poddar.

Moving forward a great Cloud ALM Roadshow, driven by Sunil Chopra. Afterwards an excellent session on SAP Business Data Cloud by Srini reddy Gottimukkula and Jitendra Ghanta.

ü§ù People who inspired me beyond words

Awesome Joule demonstration by Kousik Goon gave us a lot of insights, then Business AI with S/4 Hana delivered by Sangeeta Majumdar and GenAI Assets and Process of IBM by Aditi Chatterjee and Avijit Dhar. Moving forward great session by Arit Basu on Invoicing using SAP Business Network and SAP SAM 2505 session delivered by Abhishek Chatterjee had a powerful impact.

Then, Ritesh Agrawal delivered a session on embedding GenAI into Business Strategy, Sumanta Basu gave his insights on SAP conversational and GenAI - Bengali Chatbot, Partha Goswami conducted a session on how one can start their journey as an AI Engineer, Arghadip Kar delivered a impactful session on pre-requisities of S/4 Hana transformation, Foundation for GenAI with SAP - this great insights delivered by Vishwa Vivek Anand.

Later on, a session of SAP on AWS delivered by Amitava Nag, insights on data engineering with databricks given by Mohammad Afsar Imam, another session on Lakeflow Connect Overview delivered by Krishnendu Hazra and lastly insights on Retails Analytics on Databricks delivered by Pritam Paul.

A big thank you to the primary sponsor Westernacher Consulting and venue partner St. Xavier's University for the continuous support. Also, support by SAP PRESS, Linc Limited is commendable.

Also, thank you to all the speakers and tremendous efforts by other fellow volunteers for make this event such insightful and interesting.

Volunteering here wasn‚Äôt just about giving back ‚Äî it was about growing forward. And I‚Äôm walking away with new skills, new friends, and a renewed sense of purpose.üåü

#SAPInsideTrack #SITKolkata2025 #SAPCommunity #VolunteeringWithPurpose #TechWithHeart #GratefulAndGrowing #BehindTheScenesMagic

entry.title: Story Time - The letters "D" and "K"
entry.content:
Hey, everybody. I'm here today in the Newtown Square Library, and I want to share something with you in story time mode. Today's story is going to focus on two letters, the letters D and K. Now, those letters might make you think of a band or maybe a fashion icon, but for me, they connect to something different.

Back in June, I was lucky enough to get to go to our SAP developer meeting in Dresden, Germany, and then I also went to the one in Mannheim. While I was in Dresden, I met someone who rocks blue hair like me. Her name is Doreen Kaestner. here is a photo of me and Doreen.

And she gave me something. This bracelet. I'm not a Swifty, but I have a friendship bracelet now from Doreen from Dresden, and it says SAP Dresden on it. And I've worn it ever since. The only time I take it off is when I touch up my beard, which I need to do this weekend. But I don't want to get blue hair dye all over the bracelet. So that's the only time I take it off. Otherwise, it stays on. And it's not just about Dresden and Doreen. It's a reminder of the entire SAP community, the family I'm proud to be a part of.

 

So fast forward a few weeks. I'm down in the LATAM Roadshow in South America. I do a few events in Brazil and Lima, Peru. And then I go home because it's time for vacation. And I found myself with my family in Stockholm, Sweden. Out of nowhere, in old city near the water, someone shouts, Hey, I know you! You're from SAP. And I was like, yeah. I shook his hand and I said, hey, what's your name? He said, I'm Dorian Kaucher, DK, another DK, just like Doreen. Dorian works in a small office in southern Germany called Markdorf and focuses on sustainability initiatives. And when I asked if I could take a picture with him, he said, well, I need one, too, because I want to show all my colleagues back in the office that I met you.

 Honestly it's it's crazy because you all make me so much better by being a part of this SAP community by showing up and by connecting but it's so flattering right the energy i get from being able to be recognized is awesome and i appreciate that but i wish i could remember all your names and all your initials when i meet you but these moments they matter they matter to me so know that i do keep them inside they really do matter so from Dresden to Stockholm June to August, all the way through the year, all the way through Latin America, all the time. I'm thinking about you and you give me so much energy. And I love being a part of this SAP community because of that and because of you. So I invite you, though, that if you need something, I can help you connect to other people. So for Dorian, if you want to connect with him and talk about sustainability initiatives and all the great work him and his team are doing down in Markdorf, let me know. And if you need help from Doreen with some development, she's over in Dresden and if she can't help you with her SAP skills, maybe somebody else on the team can, she'll help connect you. I love being a connector, and other people can then connect others from that. So it's a great thing being a part of this SAP community, online and in person.

And speaking of online, Devtoberfest starts the last week of September. So I hope you're registered, and we'll see you online for that for four weeks. And then on November 4th, we're going to be online and in person for SAP TechEd. We're going to be in Berlin November 4th through 6th as well as Louisville, KY the same dates with an on tour stop, and then some of us go the next week to Sydney, Australia and after that a couple weeks later we're in Bengaluru, India.

So I promise with all of this happening I'll have more stories for you very soon. Thank you for reading, bye.

entry.title: Agenda : SAP Inside Track Hyderabad 2025 2nd Edition
entry.content:
3 Tracks

3 Panel Discussion 

20 Speakers 

There will be 3 tracks 

Venue :  CMR Institute of Technology 

https://maps.app.goo.gl/cFr44eqzPskFUxzg8

1. Analytics Track

Located in the Central Auditorium, this track covers analytics and data. The agenda includes a panel discussion on S/4HANA & AI synergy, and a session on the Open Era of SAP Analytics. Attendees will also learn about reskilling for S/4HANA and Embedded Analytics, as well as AI-driven analytics and the integration of S4HANA + DataSphere.

2. AI Track

This track, held in Seminar Hall 153, focuses on artificial intelligence within the SAP ecosystem. Topics include an introduction to AI in SAP, automated controls, and Generative AI for SAP GRC. The afternoon sessions cover transforming SAP with AI agents and intelligent enterprise, followed by a discussion on AI-driven SAP auditing.

 

3. S/4HANA Track

This track, in Seminar Hall 159, is dedicated to SAP S/4HANA. Sessions cover predictions for intelligent enterprises, unifying the cloud with SAP BTP, and building modern apps with RAP and CAP. A panel discussion on the future of autonomous agents and a session on ERP Copilots are also featured.

Attendees will also learn about reskilling for S/4HANA and Embedded Analytics, as well as AI-driven analytics and the integration of S4HANA + DataSphere.

entry.title: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
As valued members of our Community, we‚Äôd like to share upcoming changes to SAP Universal ID (UID). It is important that you have all the details to make the transition as simple as possible.

SAP is updating its SAP Universal ID framework to simplify user experiences and improve security. The key change is that the UID will no longer serve as an identity provider, meaning it will no longer represent a digital gatekeeper that checks if the person logging in is really who they say they are. Moving forward, users will have to use their e-mail address or user ID (S-/P-user) to log in. Please note that the SAP Universal ID will still be used as a wallet to collect and store user identities, community reputation and learning certificates.

The information below provides you with a view into the current state of SAP Universal ID, the upcoming changes, benefits of this evolution, and the impact on you.  

If you have any issues during the migration and this article doesn‚Äôt address them, our SAP support can help.

What is SAP Universal ID?

SAP Universal ID (UID) was created to serve as a unified personal account or wallet across all SAP systems, managing and linking various user identities such as S-/P-users. This consolidation ensured that learning certificates, awards, and community reputation are retained lifelong, regardless of organizational changes.

What¬¥s changing and what does this mean to you?

As mentioned above, SAP Universal ID will no longer serve as an identity provider. Instead, users will be authenticated through the SAP standard authentication mechanism (SAP IAS).

This change in the authentication approach requires a user password migration for all users of SAP Universal ID. For most users, those with only one user identity (S-/P-users) linked in SAP Universal ID, the password migration will happen automatically. No action is required from those users. They will continue to log in using their email address and the password they are accustomed to.

Users with more than one user identity (S-/P-users) linked in SAP Universal ID will be guided through a step-by-step process to set new password or confirm existing passwords. This will occur during the migration period, that takes place from August 25th till September 29th, 2025.

The SAP Universal ID account will remain active, allowing users to keep linking and managing their user identities in the SAP UID Account Manager. Another benefit of the UID Password Migration initiative for end users is that they lay the foundation for the future introduction of 'Remember me' functionality. Although the enablement timeline cannot be confirmed at this stage, technical preparations are underway, and we will communicate once the feature becomes available.

From September 29th, users will login with their e-mail address or user identity with the associated password. Single sign-on with SAP Universal ID will not be possible anymore. Users who haven‚Äôt gone through the password migration procedure during the mentioned period, will need to log in with any of their S-/P-user ID (or the email address associated to it) and a respective password, that was initially set during user creation. In case the password is forgotten, the ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù link can be used for reset. Passwords for the remaining users can be subsequently reset once logged in to the SAP Account Manager.

Why Is SAP Making This Change? 

This change is part of SAP‚Äôs broader identity renovation strategy. As SAP continues to evolve its identity and management solutions, the transition to identity renovation represents a new chapter in digital identity consolidation and management. While SAP Universal ID remains a pivotal part of this strategy, the shift towards SAP IAS sessions highlights the dynamic nature of enterprise technology. For customers and partners understanding and adapting to these changes will ensure optimized digital interactions within the SAP ecosystem. 

You can learn more about it in the Bring Your Own Identity: SAP's Strategic Transformation of Identity and Authentication Management blog post.

Detailed User Guide

This guide shows the single steps, you will be asked to go through to set or confirm your passwords during the UID password migration. Please note, that these steps will be required only from users with more than one user identity (S/P-user) linked in their SAP Universal ID. If you belong to the majority users, that have only one user identity (just one either S- or P-user) linked to their UID, the migration will happen automatically in the background and no action will be needed from you.

1. Once you log in, we will ask you to set new passwords to the user identities, that are linked in your SAP Universal ID. You have also the option to choose ‚Äúremind me later‚Äù. In that case, we will ask you again the next time you log in. Please keep in mind, that you should fulfill these steps until September 29th.

2. In the next screen, you will see all your linked user identities. You can either keep and confirm current password, choose to use the UID password or set a completely new password. You need to choose one of the options for each linked user identity. Once done, click on ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù.

3. To confirm your choices, we will ask you for your current SAP Universal ID password:

4. You will see a summary of your choices, once you confirmed with your UID password:

After setting successfully your passwords, you will be able to log in with your e-mail address or S-/P-user ID with the associated password.

Further Resources

Read our News article to know more about SAP‚Äôs Strategic Transformation of Identity and Authentication Management.  If you have any issues during the migration and this article didn‚Äôt address them, our SAP support can help.

entry.title: Outbound Transportation from MFG site having EWM,StRM, Lean Warehouse under one Freight Order to DC
entry.content:
Many Industries consider the manufacturing location as a plant in SAP. Under the plant, many storage locations would be available in SAP and some of them would be either IM managed (or Lean Warehouse managed), or Stock Room Managed (StRM) or EWM managed. As a part of the distribution process from the manufacturing site, there would be every chance that the different products from all these types of warehouses need to be shipped to other DC site or to the customer.

This blog covers my personal insights about the outbound process in SAP from MFG (manufacturing) site to other DC (distribution center) or to the customer wherein the different products are picked up from Lean Warehouse, StRM and EWM managed warehouse locations and loaded onto the the same vehicle under the single Freight Order (FO) with the help of SAP EWM and SAP TM ASR integration in basic S/4 HANA licence or in advanced S/4 HANA license using S/4 HANA 2023 FPS02 version. 

Process FLow - 

Process Flow - MFG Site (that has LE, StRM and EWM warehouse) to another DC / Customer in single Freight Order

Master Data -

  1. Maintain Loading Point location for EWM specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - EWM Warehouse

 2. Maintain Loading Point location for StRM specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - StRM Warehouse

3. Maintain Loading Point location for LE specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - LE Warehouse

4. Assign EWM Door in EWM Warehouse to the Loading Point - transaction code # /SCWM/DOOR_SCU -

Assign EWM Door to Loading Point

5. Assign StRM and LE Warehouse specific Door to the Loading Point - transaction code # /SCMTMS/M_ASRDOOR -

Assign StRM and LE Door to Loading Point

Documents in S/4 HANA -

1. Create multiple STO's from MFG plant to another DC.

2. Create multiple OBD's - 

EWM Relevant Delivery

Next -

StRM Relevant Delivery

Next -

Lean WH Relevant Delivery

3. Freight Unit (FU) gets created automatically and is further planned with the help of transportation cockpit automatically / manually and Freight Order (FO) is created and carrier is assigned based on the existing freight agreement arrangements.

Planning of Multiple Freight Units that have warehouse specific Loading Points

4. Perform each warehouse specific steps - picking, packing and staging.

5. Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of LE Warehouse  - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

Update in FO Execution Status after shipping steps in LE Warehouse

6. Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of StRM Warehouse  - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

FO Execution after Shipping steps in StRM Warehouse

7.Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of EWMM Warehouse - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

FO Status Overview at EWM Loading Point

Next -

FO Execution after Shipping steps in EWM Warehouse

Please share your comment and/or feedback in case of any suggestions.
Happy Reading !!!
Thanks
Prashant

Note -  The concept of usage of "Consignment Order" in ASR during the outbound process shipment for multiple customers will be covered in next blog.
Please follow topic to know more about SAP Extended Warehouse Management.
Please post and answer questions at here
Please read other posts on the topic at here

entry.title: New Features: Dark Mode (Beta) and Events Listings
entry.content:
I‚Äôm back to report a couple new improvements to SAP Community ‚Äì one that makes it more convenient to find events that interest you, and another that addresses a popular accessibility request from our feedback list.

Consolidation of Events

A community goes beyond a website. It also includes events ‚Äì both online and in-person ‚Äì that allow people to come together to learn and connect.

If you‚Äôre a community member who enjoys webinars, SAP CodeJam sessions, meet-ups, and more, then you know that you‚Äôve previously needed to comb through various sections to find events that appeal to you‚Ä¶especially in your area. There‚Äôs a general Events page, but there are also (as an example) events available through location groups. You couldn‚Äôt go to a single place on SAP Community to find every upcoming event.

Until now.

In the past, the ‚ÄúView all Events‚Äù option, accessible from the ‚ÄúEvents‚Äù pulldown menu, only offered filtering for event types (e.g., Devtoberfest, SAP CodeJam), event status (e.g., in progress, upcoming), and labels (e.g., physical, online). If you wanted to find other specific meetups and events convenient for you, you had to visit the location groups within your vicinity. Thanks to improvements rolled out today, however, the View all Events page now truly shows all events, including those hosted by location groups.

We‚Äôve expanded the Events page with filtering options for countries, making it easier for you to find even more educational and social activities close to you by pulling details from the location groups. We‚Äôve also added a filter for SAP Managed Tags that allows you to get very specific when searching for events that match your interests.

As an example, as an American, I‚Äôd love to get together with other community members at an in-person event happening near me. So for my search of events, I selected United States (for the country), SAP Community (as the tag), physical (as a label), and upcoming (as the event status) ‚Äì and, lucky me, looks like I found a cool get-together right by my office at SAP‚Äôs American headquarters in Newtown Square, Pennsylvania! (OK, that‚Äôs a made-up event from our test site, but I sure would love to participate if it were real ‚Äì especially if that dog is attending, too.)

If you‚Äôd rather not refine your search with that level of granularity, you can make multiple selections from every filter. Get as focused, or as broad, as you want. Switch between list and calendar displays while you‚Äôre at it. Play around with the various options, and we hope to see you at an event very soon!

Introducing Dark Mode (Beta)

You asked for it.

You got it.

Mostly.

Our platform now offers a dark-mode option, but it‚Äôs in a beta phase ‚Äì meaning we‚Äôre still working on features and working out some issues.

More on those in a bit. First, I want to explain how to turn dark mode on.

After logging in (log-in is required), open the pulldown menu from the person icon in the upper right, then select ‚ÄúSwitch to Dark Mode (BETA)‚Äù:

You‚Äôll immediately see the site in dark mode, although some elements of the site, such as headers and menus, remain in light mode.

As we refine this option during the beta phase, we‚Äôll apply dark mode to all parts of the site. Also, we‚Äôll fix an issue with replies in discussions, events, and direct messages. At the moment, the text in these replies is too dark to see easily.

We‚Äôre aware of the problem, and we should have it resolved before the end of the week.

Beyond those minor items, the beta is up and available for you to try out. Switch dark mode on and see what you think.

Don‚Äôt like it? Just go back to the pulldown and select ‚ÄúSwitch to Light Mode‚Äù to return to the platform‚Äôs default look and feel.

Experiment to see which experience works best for you, and remember that we‚Äôll continue to make refinements to dark mode during the beta phase.

entry.title: Rethinking Clean Core in SAP: From Rigid Formalism to Pragmatic Common Sense
entry.content:
When the Clean Core concept first entered the SAP market, it was often interpreted in an excessively pragmatic and, at times, unreasonable way by consultants and companies. What followed was a period of confusion: architects and developers applied Clean Core with an overly formalistic mindset‚Äîfocusing on the letter of the law rather than the spirit of the law, and overlooking the real context, the current state of systems, and urgent regulatory requirements.

As a result, some projects overspent on complex, costly, and low-impact initiatives. Take, for example:

  • The upcoming new tax framework in Brazil and how it will be implemented,
  • The rollout of PIX automatic payments,
  • Or the Brazilian Nota Fiscal integration with SAP DRC.

These are urgent, business-critical needs where rigid interpretations of Clean Core would not be feasible.

That‚Äôs why SAP‚Äôs new and more flexible interpretation of Clean Core is so welcome. It adapts to today‚Äôs enterprise realities‚Äîwhether modernizing ECC systems into S/4HANA, or addressing urgent legal compliance requirements‚Äîwhile keeping the principle of a maintainable, innovation-ready core intact. In the end, common sense must prevail.

Clean Core: Modernizing SAP S/4HANA Cloud with Safe, Flexible Extensibility

The Clean Core approach is SAP‚Äôs strategic vision to ensure that SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems remain up-to-date, innovation-ready, and cost-effective‚Äîwithout compromising upgradeability or system stability.

The Essence of ‚ÄúClean Core‚Äù

  • Core: critical elements‚Äîbusiness processes, master and transactional data, integrations, operations, and extensibility.
  • Clean: current, transparent, unmodified, consistent, and cloud-compliant.
  • A Clean Core system balances standardization with tailored innovation, reducing TCO and preserving agility.

Clean Core Extensibility: The Four Levels SAP has evolved from a binary model into a nuanced Clean Core Level Concept:

  • Level A ‚Äì Ideal: compliant extensions via ABAP Cloud or SAP BTP (public APIs only).
  • Level B ‚Äì Acceptable: classic, documented APIs with reasonable upgrade safety.
  • Level C ‚Äì Partial: reliance on internal objects or older approaches‚Äîhigher risk.
  • Level D ‚Äì Not Recommended: unsupported modifications, direct table writes, or noAPI objects, creating technical debt.

This framework allows companies to assess risk, remediate step by step, and prioritize modernization‚Äîespecially targeting Level D practices.

The Value

  • Upgrade stability
  • Transparent risk assessment
  • Faster innovation cycles
  • Reduced technical debt
  • Pragmatic modernization for business and legal needs

Clean Core is not about forbidding customizations‚Äîit‚Äôs about responsible extensibility. With SAP‚Äôs updated guidance, organizations can extend where it makes sense, respect compliance requirements, and still keep their ERP cores clean, stable, and future-ready.

#SAP #S4HANACloud #CleanCore #Extensibility #CloudTransformation

entry.title: White Space, Begone! New Pilot Removes Widgets Column from Blog Posts
entry.content:
For as long as I can remember, even going back to the previous SAP Community platform, members have asked us to reduce the amount of white space on post pages, arguing that the layout makes readability more difficult. It‚Äôs a complaint that continues today ‚Äì and one that we‚Äôre taking steps to address.

The current platform includes a column for widgets (e.g., Top Kudoed Authors), but, depending on the length of a blog post, that column might be mostly blank. For that reason, members have requested its removal, and we‚Äôre now testing the favorability of that approach.

To help illustrate the point, here‚Äôs a blog post with the widgets column:

Now here‚Äôs the very same post with the widgets column (and white space) removed:

What do you think? Better? Worse? Don‚Äôt care one way or the other? We‚Äôre running a four-week pilot (starting today) so you can let us know!

To experience a blog board free of the widgets column (and the white space that comes with), head on over to the Application Development and Automation group. We‚Äôre currently testing that look and feel over there to give members the opportunity to view blog posts without the widgets.

(Note: We are aware of issues with the formatting of some posts now that we've removed the widgets column. If this change affected the placement of images in your post, for example, you'll need to edit to correct. Per the "Blog Formatting Post-Migration" section of this post, it's best to use the blog tool as intended, making sure to avoid complicated html and to clear formatting when copying over text.)  

Compare the blog posts in the Application Development and Automation group to blog posts in other areas on the community. If you prefer the new widget-less layout, let us know in the comments below. Or, if you favor blog posts with widgets and the white space, make sure to share your opinions in the comments as well. We‚Äôll review all feedback received between today (Tuesday, August 26) and Tuesday, September 23, then determine which layout members seem to favor.

If enough members choose the new approach (with the widgets and space gone), we can update all blog boards to match what you see in the Application Development and Automation group. Then again, if members tell us to leave the current layout alone, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôll do (and we‚Äôll switch the Application Development and Automation posts back to match the other boards).

Will we change the status of this feedback item to ‚ÄúDelivered‚Äù? Or ‚ÄúDeclined‚Äù? You can help us decide!

With this pilot, we‚Äôre inviting members to provide feedback that will help influence the design of our site ‚Äì as it should be in a community that belongs to all of us.

We look forward to reading your input below!

entry.title: SAP Translation Hub
entry.content:
–•–æ—á–µ—Ç–µ –ø–æ–¥–æ–ª–∞—Ç–∏ –º–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –±–∞—Ä'—î—Ä–∏ —Ç–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –≤–µ—Å—å –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü—ñ–∞–ª SAP —Ä—ñ–¥–Ω–æ—é –º–æ–≤–æ—é?

–ó–∞—Ä–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø—ñ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏–π –≤–µ–±—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä, —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏—Ö –∑–º—ñ–Ω —É –≤–∞—à–æ–º—É –ø—ñ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—ñ –¥–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥—É –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–±–µ–∑–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è.

–ü—Ä–∏—î–¥–Ω—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –¥–æ –Ω–∞—à–æ—ó –ø–∞–Ω–µ–ª—ñ –µ–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ñ–≤, —è–∫—ñ —Ä–æ–∑–∫—Ä–∏—é—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π–Ω—ñ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ Translation Hub —ñ–∑ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–ø–ª–∏–≤–æ—é –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –≤ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É —á–∞—Å—ñ, —â–æ–± –ø—Ä–æ—ñ–ª—é—Å—Ç—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –π–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π –≤–ø–ª–∏–≤. –ì–æ—Ç—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –Ω–∞–¥–∏—Ö–Ω—É—Ç–∏—Å—è!

üá∫üá¶–¶—ñ–∫–∞–≤–∏–π —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç: —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ –º–æ–≤–∞ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å—ñ —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω—å SAP —É–∂–µ –º–∞–π–∂–µ 20 —Ä–æ–∫—ñ–≤, –∞ –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω—å SAP —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—ñ—è–º–∏ ‚Äî 30 —Ä–æ–∫—ñ–≤!

–ó–∞ —Ü–µ–π —á–∞—Å —Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ç—É–∂–Ω—É –±–∞–∑—É —Ç–µ—Ä–º—ñ–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ—ó —Ç–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞—Ü—å–∫–∏—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö, —â–æ –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—î –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –µ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ SAP Translation Hub —ñ –∑–∞–±–µ–∑–ø–µ—á—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –≤–∏—Å–æ–∫—É —è–∫—ñ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥—É —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—é.

–†–∞–¥–∏–º–æ –æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è –∑ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å—É —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —ó—Ö –Ω–∞ –≤–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∏—Ö –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—ñ–∞–ª–∞—Ö.

üìå–†–æ–∑–∫—Ä–∏–π—Ç–µ –≥–ª–æ–±–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –∑ SAP Translation Hub!

üìÖ–î–∞—Ç–∞: 29 —Å–µ—Ä–ø–Ω—è 2025 —Ä–æ–∫—É
‚è≤Ô∏è –ß–∞—Å: 12.30 –∑–∞ –ö–∏—î–≤–æ–º
üîó–ó–∞—Ä–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑
